column4: my weather desklet keeps saying retrieval failed and [ambiguous]  after the city name.  it used to work fine, and obviously my internet connection is working fine.
someone else had a similar complaint here yesterday -- the problem is thus probably on the server side
it has been doing this for over a month now
you'd think they would have it fixed by now
you would, wouldn't you? Perhaps you need to change a URL in your configuration.
there are no URL's.
you just type in the city name and it (supposedly) reports the weather
there is a workaround for it, but it's frustrating me that it isn't working like it's supposed to
now think about this carefully: how would it retrieve information online, if not through some URL?
i meant there is nowhere (other than that workaround thing) where you have to configure it to retrieve from a certain URL.
it's supposed to be automated is all i'm saying, and it's weird how it just up and stopped working one day
surely, the URL is configured in some file somewhere in your $HOME
providing even a simple service for free is a lossmaking business. Perhaps they just shut it down.
i believe that the desklet is compiled with most major US cities and their respective URL's.  so unless i want to re-compile the script...
Try this: 'cd ~ ; for i in .* ; do find $i -print0 | xargs -0 grep -l Chicago' if you have configured Chicago. That should spit out a list of files containing the string Chicago.
oops, forgot a '; done' at the end
what if the name of the city is two words?
'cd ~ ; for i in .* ; do find $i -print0 | xargs -0 grep -l Two\ Words ; done'
better yet, 'cd ~ ; for i in .* ; do find $i -print0 | xargs -0 grep -l Baton.Rouge ; done'
improving it further, 'cd ~ ; for i in .* ; do find $i -print0 | xargs -0 grep -il Baton.Rouge ; done'
none. But NFS would be the traditional unix way of sharing directories across networks.
